landing.title: Vanesa Carlotto Miranda
landing.subtitle: Psychologist
landing.phrase: Because connecting beyond distance is possible

about.first: I am Vanesa Carlotto Miranda, a Licensed Psychologist from Business and Social Sciences University (UCES), MN.56669 MP.74831. A Special Education Teacher with a focus on Mental Disability at the Higher Institute of Special Education Teaching (Ispee). Specialist in Clinical Psychology with Children and Adolescents from the University of Buenos Aires (UBA).
about.second: I have over a decade of experience in the field of mental health, providing care to people of all ages who face emotional and psychological challenges. In my professional practice, I seek to create a safe and confidential space where my patients can explore their thoughts, feelings, and experiences, working together to develop effective strategies to overcome the challenges they face.
about.third: I believe in every person's ability to grow and improve their quality of life. My commitment is to accompany my patients in this process, providing them with tools and support needed to achieve emotional well-being.

first.title: Individual Therapy for Adults
first.text: I work with each adult patient on the current issue they present, taking into account their context and history. The treatment is oriented toward decision-making, aiming with the adult patient to resolve conflicts by understanding the reasons behind their suffering.

second.title: Individual Therapy for Adolescents
second.text: I accompany adolescents in overcoming their emotional, behavioral, and social difficulties. The goal is to develop the necessary skills to face the challenges of this stage of life as a transition into adulthood. Adolescents receiving treatment can improve their mood, develop coping skills, and enhance their relationships with others.

third.title: Psychological Guidance for Families which support Individuals with Disabilities
third.text: My years of experience in treating individuals with disabilities allow me to provide emotional support, guidance, and strategies to help families face the associated challenges. I support families in:

list.a: Processing their emotions related to their loved one's disability, such as sadness, frustration, or concern.
list.b: Informing family members about the specific disability, its implications, and how they can best support their loved one.
list.c: Teaching techniques to manage stress, anxiety, and additional demands that may arise due to the disability.
list.d: Facilitating effective communication between family members and helping resolve conflicts that may arise.
list.e: Connecting families with other professionals, services, or resources that may benefit both the family member with the disability and their caregivers.
list.f: Helping families plan for the future, including decisions about long-term care, education, and ongoing support.

fourth.title: Supervision for Professionals Working with Individuals with Disabilities
fourth.text: I deal with technical aspects, skills, and resources of professionals (psychologists, therapeutic companions, teachers, etc.) to increase their effectiveness in the assessment and intervention they perform. It involves several key aspects:

list.b: Training in intervention methods and personalized support. Training in the use of access and learning accommodations.
list.c: Teaching strategies to promote autonomy and social inclusion, aiming to solve barriers to inclusion.
list.d: Emotional support and strategies to manage stress and professional burnout.
list.e: Adaptation of strategies according to the individual needs of each person with a disability, fostering flexibility to adjust working methods as progress and changes in conditions occur.
list.f: In summary, I support professionals working with individuals with disabilities to provide comprehensive and quality support, promoting their well-being and maximum development.

first.question: How does psychological therapy help?
first.text: It contributes to improving mental health and emotional well-being. Through the therapeutic process, I help individuals address and overcome a variety of emotional and psychological challenges. I accompany you in:
first.a: The path of self-discovery and personal growth, providing a safe and confidential space to explore your thoughts, emotions, and behaviors. This self-awareness can lead to a greater understanding of yourself and promote personal growth.
first.b: Managing stress and anxiety, using therapeutic techniques to identify and manage the sources of stress and anxiety in your life, teaching you effective strategies to cope with them and reduce their negative impact.
first.c: Improving personal relationships, enhancing your communication skills and interpersonal relationships, helping you set healthy boundaries and resolve conflicts constructively.
first.d: Healing emotional wounds and past traumas, providing tools to process and release emotional pain.
first.e: Developing life skills, building practical abilities to face daily challenges, improve decision-making, and increase emotional resilience.
first.f: Boosting self-esteem, by working on your limiting thoughts and beliefs, therapy can help you build a more positive self-image and increase your confidence.
first.g: Support during difficult times, through transitions and challenging life moments such as losses, breakups, or significant changes.
first.h: In summary, investing in your mental health through psychological therapy not only improves your quality of life but also equips you to face the future with greater strength and optimism.

second.question: Why choose online therapy?
second.text: This type of therapy offers several advantages, such as greater accessibility for people in remote areas, flexible session schedules, and the comfort of receiving treatment from home. Virtual psychotherapy can be provided ethically and effectively, adapting traditional techniques and methods to the digital environment to ensure positive results for my patients. I invite you to discover the benefits of virtual psychotherapy:
second.a: Access treatment from any geographic location, even remote areas where services may be limited.
second.b: Save time and reduce stress associated with commuting.
second.c: Facilitates the scheduling of therapy sessions that better fit today's busy schedules.
second.d: Itâ€™s easier to start the therapeutic process from the comfort of your home, which can reduce the initial anxiety associated with in-person consultations.
second.e: Virtual psychotherapy not only improves the accessibility and flexibility of psychological treatment but can also make therapy more comfortable and less intimidating for some people, helping to overcome traditional barriers to accessing mental health care.
